intro: Erigeron platyphyllus, commonly known as the flatleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are broadly ovate and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron platyphyllus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
